problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: What is the difference between bryophytes and tracheophytes?
options: Bryophytes have fibrous roots while tracheophytes have a singular taproot
Bryophytes are vascular, tracheophytes are nonvascular
Bryophytes have a red pigment, tracheophytes have a green pigment
Bryophytes are nonvascular, tracheophytes are vascular
problems.hint: This comparison has to do entirely with vascularization
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option B, bryophytes (like moss, fern, etc) do not have a vascular system, so they make use of diffusion and osmosis. Tracheophytes, on the other hand, have a vascular system to supply tall plants (think of trees).

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: What are the three types of vascular (Tracheophytes) plants?
options: Angiosperms, gymnosperms, and seedless vascular plants
problems.hint: Sporophytes and gametophytes are plant generations, not types of vascular plants.
problems.detailed: The correct answer here is option D. Vascular plants can be further divided into angiosperms (flowering and fruit-producing plants); gymnosperms (cone and needle producing plants); and seedless vascular plants.

problems.author: Josephine Ankomah
problems.question: Which of the following is INCORRECT?
options: Monocots have parallel veins while dicots have net-like veins
Dicots roots have vascular system arranged in a ring; monocot roots have a vascular system that is scattered
Monocots have 1 a cotyleton; eudicots have 3 cotyledons
Monocots have a fibrous root system, dicots have a taproot system
problems.detailed: The correct answer is option C, monocots have 1 cotyledon while eudicots have 2 cotyledons.
